summary: This is a January 8, 2021 case update from the Public Corruption Unit regarding the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the indictment, arrest, discovery process, bail denial, and ongoing efforts to interview Prince Andrew via an MLAT request.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged in a six-count indictment for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls. She was arrested in New Hampshire and has been detained.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The prosecution team is pursuing a potential interview with him. After his counsel declined a voluntary interview, the team initiated an MLAT request.

connections.description: The prosecution's pursuit of an interview with Prince Andrew is part of the investigation into Maxwell's case, implying a potential connection relevant to the inquiry.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury returned a six-count indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested at a residence in New Hampshire.

events.title: Initial Discovery Production
events.description: The prosecution team made its initial discovery production in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Discovery Completed
events.description: The prosecution completed discovery in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Bail Application Denied
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's second application for bail was denied by the court.

events.title: MLAT Request for Prince Andrew
events.description: After Prince Andrew's counsel declined a voluntary interview, the prosecution team notified OIA to proceed with a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request to interview him.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on June 29, 2020, on six counts related to facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.
Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, in New Hampshire and has been detained since her arrest.
The prosecution is actively pursuing an interview with Prince Andrew and has initiated an MLAT request after his counsel refused a voluntary interview.
Maxwell's second bail application was denied in December 2020, and pretrial motions were due in February 2021.
The prosecution team is coordinating with multiple entities, including the USAO-SDFL, OPR, and the West Palm Beach Police Department, to gather materials from the prior Epstein investigation.
